alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Central Orangeburg; Kershaw; Lee; Lexington; Northwestern Orangeburg; Richland; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Lee, Calhoun, southeastern Lexington, northwestern Sumter, east central Aiken, north central Orangeburg, Richland and southwestern Kershaw Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 530 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Lake Carolina to 8 miles northeast of Aiken State Park. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Sumter, Orangeburg, Cayce, Forest Acres, Shaw Air Base, McEntire Air Base, Brookdale, Dentsville, Pine Ridge, St. Matthews, Gaston, Arcadia Lakes, Eastover, Oakland, Sesquicentennial State Park, SC State Fair Grounds, Fort Jackson, Congaree National Park, and Hopkins. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 74 and 89. Interstate 26 between mile markers 116 and 151. Interstate 77 between mile markers 1 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central South Carolina.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Central Orangeburg; Kershaw; Lee; Lexington; Northwestern Orangeburg; Richland; Sumter
